Package org.digidoc4j

Class ContainerOpener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.digidoc4j.ContainerOpener
  • public class ContainerOpener
extends Object
    Helper class for opening containers. The proper way of opening containers would be using ContainerBuilder, for example using ContainerBuilder.fromExistingFile(String) and ContainerBuilder.fromStream(InputStream).
    See Also:
    ContainerBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • open

        public static Container open​(String path,
                             Configuration configuration)
                      throws DigiDoc4JException
        Open container from a file. Use ContainerBuilder.fromExistingFile(String) instead.
        Parameters:
        path - file name and path.
        configuration - configuration settings
        Returns:
        container new container of the specified format
        Throws:
        DigiDoc4JException - when the file is not found or empty
        See Also:
        ContainerBuilder

      • open

        public static Container open​(InputStream stream,
                             boolean actAsBigFilesSupportEnabled)
        Open container from a stream. Use ContainerBuilder.fromStream(InputStream) instead.
        Parameters:
        stream - input stream
        actAsBigFilesSupportEnabled - acts as configuration parameter
        Returns:
        container
        See Also:
        returns true used for BDOC, ContainerBuilder

      • open

        public static Container open​(InputStream stream,
                             Configuration configuration)
        Open container from a stream. Use ContainerBuilder.fromStream(InputStream) instead.
        Parameters:
        stream - stream of a container to open.
        configuration - configuration settings.
        Returns:
        opened container.
        See Also:
        ContainerBuilder
